textos_fuente.text: Venue Rental | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest Celebrate Create Unforgettable Memories at the Charming and Historic 1918 Davie School Whether you’re planning an elegant wedding, graduation, birthday party , or retirement celebration, the dedicated team at Old Davie School is here to ensure your day is truly one to remember. With the flexibility to choose your own caterers, photographers, musicians, and florists, the possibilities are endless to craft the event of your dreams. Contact us today to learn more or to schedule a personalized tour of our beautiful venue! The Historic Auditorium The Historic Auditorium in the 1918 Davie School is a stunning venue that combines timeless charm with modern amenities, making it the ideal setting for a wedding reception. The space boasts beautiful, gleaming hardwood floors that add warmth and elegance to the atmosphere. Large windows allow an abundance of natural light to flood the room, The rich history of the building adds a unique, romantic touch, creating a memorable backdrop for your special day. The Historic Auditorium provides the perfect ambiance for an unforgettable wedding reception. This venue space can accommodate up to 175 guests and includes the outdoor authentic Seminole Chickee Hut perfect for ceremonies or an outdoor cocktail hour. Harmony Grove Harmony Grove is a picturesque setting for an outdoor wedding ceremony. Choose between the shady area under the Plum trees or the amphitheater on the south end.  The backdrop of natural everglades landscape and the shade of the large Jambolyn Plum trees make for a beautiful area for you and your guests. Heritage Hall Heritage Hall is a versatile and elegant venue, perfect for hosting a wide range of events, from business meetings and music recitals to graduations, retirement parties, bridal showers, weddings, and other special occasions. The space is defined by its impressive high ceilings, creating an open, airy atmosphere that adds grandeur to any event, as well as its grand stage. Its flexible layout allows it to serve as a blank canvas, easily adaptable to fit any vision or theme. Whether you’re planning a formal gathering, a casual celebration, or a creative affair, Heritage Hall offers the ideal setting to bring your event to life and can hold up to 150 people. The outdoor Courtyard area can be added on for ceremonies, cocktail parties, and more. Orange Villa The Orange Villa, a historic home built in 1914, is the perfect location for your boutique event–ceremonies and receptions, cocktail parties, baby or bridal showers, the possibilities are endless. The first floor of the home includes the beautiful sunroom, living room, dining room and caterer’s kitchen. This venue space can hold up to 20 people and is perfect for intimate gatherings. Outdoor spaces around the campus can be added on to elevate your event to the next level. Request Booking Information No matter what stage of planning you are in, we are here to help! Fill in the form below and someone will be in touch with you shortly. We look forward to hearing from you. Request Booking Information Full Name * E-Mail * Phone Number * What type of event are you looking for? * Event Date * Is your date flexible? * Yes No How did you hear about us? * Google Facebook Instagram Vendor Referral Client Referral The Knot WeddingWire Zola Other Tells more about your event! * LOCATION 6650 Griffin Road, Davie, FL 33314 954-797-1044 Email MUSEUM & EVENT VENUE OFFICE: Tuesday—Saturday 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. MUSEUM TOURS: Explore the "Plan Your Visit" page above to learn about tour opportunities. 2020 Orange Blossom Fest | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest 83rd Annual Orange Blossom Festival The Old Davie School has been a part of Davie's historic Orange Blossom Festival for the past 83 years. Be a part of the local tradition by stopping by the Old Davie School Historical Museum! The Old Davie School will be hosting tons of free, fun, and family-friendly activities all weekend long. Stop by for free guided tours, pancake breakfast, flea market, and experience authentic pioneer cooking! Like the event on our Facebook page for the latest news and updates on the event! Like Event Schedule Feb 29th - March 1st Opens at 9am Opening at 9am, stop by Old Davie School to browse our Flea Market! Every purchase from the Flea Market goes back into helping to maintain operations at the Old Davie School. Contact us for more info if you wish to donate any items you for the Flea Market! Feb 29th - March 1st 12-2pm Take a quick snack break with our pioneer food! We will be using recipes from authentic pioneer cookbooks just like they did it, over an open fire. Stop by between 12-2pm to learn their techniques and try free samples! Feb 29th - March 1st 12:30pm & 1:30pm Take a step back in time with a free guided tour of the Old Davie School. Learn about the fascinating history of Davie, hardships of early Florida pioneer life, and preservation efforts to teach future generations. March 1st 11am - 2pm Due to popular demand, the Old Davie Car & Truck Show is back! This free and family-friendly event showcases a wide variety of cars from Model-Ts to dragsters. Which car will win this year's first-place prize? If you think yours has a shot, then register it today to enter the show! Contact Us Like Event Like Event Enter Your Car LOCATION 6650 Griffin Road, Davie, FL 33314 954-797-1044 Email MUSEUM & EVENT VENUE OFFICE: Tuesday—Saturday 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. MUSEUM TOURS: Explore the "Plan Your Visit" page above to learn about tour opportunities. Copyright © Old Davie School Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest Privacy Policy Scroll to top

PRICE THIS VENUE 1 / 8 Provided by: Old Davie School Historical Museum Report Old Davie School Historical Museum 954-797-1044 CALL VENUE FAVORITE Venue highlights Indoor and outdoor spaces BYO Upgraded rentals included Venue details Style: Historic/Landmark Building, Outdoor Guest capacity: Accommodates up to 175 guests Services: Ceremony / Reception Indoor / Outdoor VIEW OPTIONS Location: 6650 Griffin Road Davie, FL 33314 Description: Celebrate your nuptials in a historical setting that will bless your marriage with the same longevity that marks its existence – Old Davie School. Originally built in 1918, the Old Davie School house is the oldest permanent school in Broward County. The beautiful historic campus is a perfect place to host your wedding celebration. The newly completed Amphitheater is a picturesque setting for a heartfelt outdoor ceremony. The backdrop of natural everglades landscape and the shade of large Jambolyn Plum trees make for a beautiful setting to say “I do,” in front of guests. Following the ceremony guests can enjoy cocktail hour under the school’s authentic Seminole Chickee Hut. The open air, thatched roof venue also provides a unique alternative for your ceremony.  Meanwhile you can enjoy a quiet moment together and pose for photographs. Many settings are available for portraits throughout the school and 10-acre property. After cocktail hour, the festivities continue with dinner and dancing in the schoolhouse museum’s auditorium. The Old Davie School staff is dedicated to making your special day and event to remember. READ MORE Additional details Service Options Venue notes The 2021 Ultimate Wedding Package is $6,500 for a 6 hour event that includes a Bridal Suite, Library Suite, Amphitheater/outdoor wedding space with white garden chairs, chickee hut for cocktail hour with 8 high top tables, Auditorium for reception with chivari chairs, Ample time is provided for set up and clean up at no extra charge. Additional hours can be arranged for a fee of $500/hr. A refundable security deposit of $800 is required. Please call for 2022 rental pricing. Amenities and Restrictions Amenities - Bride's dressing area - Groom's dressing area - Tables and chairs provided - Upgraded chairs - Outdoor lighting - Venue set up and clean up - Day-of coordinator - Kitchen for prep only - Large parking lot - Dance area Restrictions - BYO alcohol - General liability insurance required - No rice, birdseed, confetti, etc. - Approved outside caterer allowed - Amplified music OK indoors and outdoors - Smoking in designated areas only - Music must end by 11:00PM - Outdoor music must end by 8:00PM - No outside furniture unless pre approved by venue Amenities - Bride's dressing area - Groom's dressing area - Tables and chairs provided - Upgraded chairs - Outdoor lighting - Venue set up and clean up - Day-of coordinator - Kitchen for prep only - Large parking lot - Dance area Restrictions - BYO alcohol - General liability insurance required - No rice, birdseed, confetti, etc. - Approved outside caterer allowed - Amplified music OK indoors and outdoors - Smoking in designated areas only - Music must end by 11:00PM - Outdoor music must end by 8:00PM - No outside furniture unless pre approved by venue Links Old Davie School Historical Museum 954-797-1044 CALL VENUE FAVORITE Venue Highlights Indoor and outdoor spaces BYO Upgraded rentals included STARTING AT $3,262 FOR 50 GUESTS Price this venue to get your customized estimate, no strings attached PRICE THIS VENUE Interested in this venue? Endless Opportunity at FAU Davie | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest Endless Opportunity at FAU Davie May 15, 2021 By Nenita P. Wild — Old Davie School Intern, Graduate of FAU History Masters program. Formative Years at the Florida Atlantic University Davie in the late 1980s was still mostly undeveloped and well-known for its rural appeal—but there was high demand for higher education in the area. Broward County in this period was the second most populous county in the state. State legislators recognized the need for a public university in the county, which resulted in Florida Atlantic University (FAU) expanding its campus to Davie. In an interview with Dr. Joyanne Stephens conducted by Nenita P. Wild, a history grad student at FAU Boca, she provided a glimpse of FAU’s formative years. Dr. Stephens was assistant to the Broward Provost in 1989, who coordinated and worked closely with the Deans and administrators at the FAU Boca campus to grow the programs in Broward. Prior to Dr. Stephens’s retirement, she was the vice president and associate provost of regional campuses in FAU and worked tirelessly to meet the goal in providing the students with higher education. Cape Fear, 1991. Locations throughout South Florida were featured in the movie. During the expansion years of FAU in Davie, there was no I-595 for easy commuting, but many faculty members like Dr. Stephens were committed to making a difference in the student life on campus. She shared a fun-fact of one of the memorable experiences during her first semester at the Davie Campus.  Before the construction of the buildings in the early 1990s, the faculty and staff members of FAU occupied rented buildings at Broward Community College. She said, “I arrived on Monday morning to see the first floor of our rented building totally transformed. Hallways had been narrowed, fake exposed ductwork.  What was going on? [They were filming] a remake of the movie ‘Cape Fear’ and our building was part of the action.” FAU grew from the rented floors to state-of-the-art buildings that fosters student’s dreams of higher education. Learning Opportunities in Rural Davie The programs at FAU Davie were designed to cater to the needs of students in the area, especially those from Broward Community College (BCC). The partnership of FAU and BCC was called a two-plus-two, where FAU offered the junior and senior courses of the undergraduate programs, as well as graduate programs. Dr. Stephens described this partnership, “as the model for university/community college relationships. With the support of our Deans and faculty from both FAU and BCC, the emphasis was placed on the articulation of programs and assuring that students move seamlessly from BCC to FAU.” Students in the area were from different backgrounds including non-traditional, older, and married with families. Many of the courses at FAU were offered in the evening—from 4 in the afternoon and on Saturdays. More importantly, according to Dr. Stephens, “most students were first generation; the first in their family to attend college.” The student body also consisted of “minority students whose parents had migrated from the Caribbean, South and Central America.” The diversity of the students inspired the faculty, both those who were hired to be full time faculty for the Davie campus and faculty who came from the Boca Campus.  According to Dr. Stephens the combination of resident and traveling faculty “allowed the university to offer complete degree programs on the Davie Campus, essential for students with complex lives who needed educational opportunities close to work and home.”  Dr. Stephens commented, “many were Broward County teachers who would rush from their classes to ours, working on graduate degrees.  Others were older students, women and men, who had interrupted their education to marry and raise a family.” There were traditional age students as well who worked full time and needed a campus close to their jobs.  Dr. Stephens was so proud of the students enrolled at FAU’s Davie Campus.  She said,” I love, love, love non- traditional students.  They are focused, committed and grateful for the opportunities that BC and FAU provides. The $14.5 million FAU/BCC University/College Library expanded the old library’s holdings by more than 100,000 volumes, expanded its physical size from 37,000 square feet to 112,000, and added sophisticated technological capabilities to benefit students. 1994. By 1990, FAU fully opened its doors to students from BCC and others in the area who were seeking a bachelor and master’s degree.  In the later years, the multi-million-dollar state of the art library and other classroom facilities were constructed. The library was a symbol of the partnership between Florida Atlantic University and Broward Community College (BCC). While the Davie campus was still considered to be in a rural area, it was successful in providing local students a chance to pursue their degree in higher education. Go Owls! The partnership between FAU and BCC was “wonderful” as Dr. Stephens noted. Dr. Stephens joined FAU in 1989 and after a year, the enrollment reached around one thousand students in Davie. By 2007, the enrollment increased to six thousand students. FAU continued to expand its academic programs in Broward that resulted in the growth of faculty and staff members as well. When Florida Atlantic University looked to expand offerings in downtown Fort Lauderdale, BCC was pleased to share its site. In closing, it was a great honor and privilege to interview Dr. Stephens, especially her openness to share the historical event of FAU Davie through her personal memories. With this interview, undoubtedly, she was one of the driving forces who enabled FAU to thrive in the midst of adversity. As an alumnus at FAU Boca, I am a proud nontraditional student who earned a degree in higher education under the tutelage of scholars like Dr. Stephens whose goal was to foster the student’s interest in education. Construction Nearing Completion on Agricultural and Citrus Packing House at Old Davie School Historical Museum | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest Construction Nearing Completion on Agricultural and Citrus Packing House at Old Davie School Historical Museum February 1, 2017 New Interactive Educational Exhibit allows Students  and Museumgoers to Step Back in Time to the Pioneer Days Construction is nearing completion on the Agricultural and Citrus Packing House Exhibit at the Old Davie School Historical Museum. The new exhibit will become a part of the Step-Back-in-Time interactive educational program that demonstrates the life of Davie pioneers to the thousands of students and museumgoers that frequent the historical campus each year. The Agricultural and Citrus Packing House Exhibit places Davie in the context of a growing Florida citrus industry by using equipment donated by Math Igler Grove, a citrus grove and packing house business that has operated in Davie since the 1950s. “This new exhibit will provide an opportunity for both residents and tourists to understand how oranges are grown, harvested and marketed, and to understand the tremendous influence the industry had on Davie and Florida’s history,” said Leslie Schroeder, Executive Director of the Museum. The equipment was donated after the Old Davie School Historical Museum Board of Trustees became aware that the business was being dismantled to make way for the development of homes and a park. The equipment consists of scrubber sections, which cleaned the fruit; the sorting section, where workers pulled the fruit that was too small for shipping; the wax and dryer, to polish the fruit; and, the bin area to prepare the fruit for shipping. The exhibit will include the citrus packing equipment, antique farm equipment and other early 20th century artifacts. The building will visually replicate an original citrus packing house and will prominently display the citrus packing house equipment to allow visitors to experience the packing process. Citrus crates and signage will be placed around the packing equipment to replicate the interior of a citrus packing house as it was in the 1940s. Photographs, ledger books noting production schedules, collection bags, clothing and other items associated with Davie’s citrus farms, along with agricultural equipment from the early 1900s to the 1950s, including a tractor, hay rake, oxen plow and other unique implements used to farm in the Everglades will be arranged in a manner to help a visitor think they are stepping back into a moment in time. The design, fabrication and installation of the exhibit will be completed with the help of museum staff, as well as donated time by local grove owners, architects, engineers, contractors, graphic designers, writers and photographers. About the Foundation | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest About the Foundation The Davie School Foundation was established in 1984 to protect and restore the Davie School to the integrity of its earlier appearance. The Foundation in conjunction with the Town of Davie, the Broward County School Board, the Soroptimist International of Davie, the Davie Historical Society and the community at large has worked tirelessly to preserve this important piece of Broward County’s history. Support Three Ways to Get Involved Become a Member Join the Davie School Foundation and help preserve our heritage by becoming a member today. Learn More Give a Gift Show someone you care by donating in their honor to the Old Davie School. Learn More Volunteer Volunteers are the heart of the Old Davie School. Get involved today by becoming a docent, volunteering for events and many more opportunities. Field Trip Programs | Old Davie School Museum & Event Venue Plan Your Visit Upcoming Events The Venues Education Field Trips Homeschool Days Virtual Programming Summertime Program 2025 Davie Elementary Yearbook Project Join & Support Become a Member Become a Sponsor Give Volunteer About History of the Davie School About the Foundation Film & Photography Press & Newsletter Sign Up for E-News Directions Menu Menu Facebook Instagram Youtube Pinterest Learn Live History with Educational Programs Educational Programs at the Old Davie School provide an up-close, hands-on experience that brings the story of the Everglades frontier to life. The Old Davie School educational programs can be adapted to meet the needs of your group, and welcomes public and private schools, homeschool groups and civic organizations. For assistance with funding, ask your school about the School Board of Broward County’s Supplemental Arts and Sciences Program (SASP). Groups are welcome to bring their own bag lunches, and eat at the outdoor picnic tables or under the Chickee Hut after the tour.  The gift shop is located in the Museum Office and available to student groups by request. All programs are designed to meet the Florida Next Generation Sunshine State Standards . For more information or to submit your field request, click here Reviews From Teachers “ As teachers, we enjoyed the overall experience and watching our students excitement as things taught in our classrooms came to life for them. ” “ The curriculum that was taught was relevant and informative. Every activity was a learning opportunity. ” “ My students are studying historical Florida and having an experience like this, really helps them understand what it was like back then. ” Step Back in Time Kindergarten – 5th grade The Step Back in Tim e interactive program investigates life as it was for the pioneers of Davie and western Broward through artifacts, photographs, and hands-on activities. Tour the historic Davie School—built in 1918—and recreate the students’ first day. Students attend a lesson in the restored classroom and practice writing with dip ink pens and explore the museum exhibits. Other activities may include a tour through the 1909 Florida Pioneer House and washing laundry on a washboard, meeting farm animals, pumping water from the well, making fresh orange juice or butter, or visiting the vegetable garden and authentic Seminole Chickee Hut. Program Time: 2 Hour Program. Tuesday – Friday, by reservation only. The tour starts promptly at 10:00 a.m. and runs until 12:00 p.m. Program Cost: $10 per student; one chaperone required per ten students, admitted free. $8 additional chaperones. Number of Participants: 20 minimum, 100 maximum Updated Curriculum Guide for 2025 – 2026! Download the Step Back in Time Curriculum Guide with activities for students and additional information for teachers. Curriculum Guide Additional Program Opportunities We can gear and adapt our program for any age-range or needs. Please contact our Education Director at education@olddavieschool.org for more information. Learn More Other Amazing Programs High School Volunteers Looking to earn volunteer hours for graduation requirements? Email join@olddavieschool.org to join our Contact List for upcoming opportunities! Time Travelers Club Summertime Program The Time Travelers Club Summertime program is a chance for Summer Camps around Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach to visit the Old Davie School and experience an old-fashioned summertime! The 90-minute program takes campers back in time to what life was like for children 100 years ago. Scheduling for the program begins in February. Scout Programs Interested in completing merit badge requirements or projects with the Old Davie School? Contact education@olddavieschool.org or call 954-797-1044 for more information. Sign-up Our Mission Old Davie School enriches the community as a timeless destination linking our past, present, and future. PAST : … by preserving the history of Davie and western Broward and engaging a variety of audiences through exhibits, programming, and field trips. PRESENT : … by offering a venue for creating memories through social events, workshops and classes, event rentals, and other educational experiences. FUTURE : … by seizing opportunities for growth and change to reflect the ever-evolving community of South Florida.
